page.title: 01General Description of Area
page.content: The village of Great Barton which lies on rising ground on the A143 three miles NE of Bury St. Edmunds and is in the administrative Borough of St. Edmundsbury, has 1499 people on the Electoral Register and a total population of 1850 (last count 1983) It is a main road village with flint and stone cottages (original Estate cottages) on both sides of the village street. We are one of the few villages which has a footpath on the main road all the way into Bury. Our village reflects the modern motor car age as most families have a car (or even two) and most villagers com- mute to work in all directions. Most of the dwellings lie to the West of the main road. Many families have both parents out to work. In the new res- idential estates which have been built in the village, the people are in the
